key_mistakes.reason: Deviates from standard central control opening moves.
Exchange loses tempo without gaining significant advantage.
Loses time by blocking the bishop's natural development.
Allows White to maintain a more flexible pawn structure.
Loses tempo by retreating the bishop unnecessarily.
Non-developing move that doesn't address immediate threats.
Queen move doesn't create threats or serve a strategic purpose.
Gives away the advantage by not consolidating position.
Allows Black to simplify the position, reducing White's advantage.

recommendations: Focus on central control in the opening.
Avoid unnecessary exchanges that do not provide a clear advantage.
Ensure king safety before launching an attack.
